hanzi-su-wiki:
額

Значения

Сумма, количество; рамка, оправа; лоб

Мнемоника

По этикету глава 頁 дома и гость 客 должны раскланиваться. Лоб, т.к. бьют друг другу челом. Количество поклонов оговаривается ритуалом.

Варианты

额

heisig_chinese_memo: Sign the guestbook page with your forehead. (Picture a guestbook full of forehead prints like thumbprints).
heisig_constituent: forehead, guest, house, each, walking legs, mouth, head, page, one, ceiling, drop, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight
heisig_story: As Miss Manners will be the first to tell you, out of respect, one does not look straight into the eyes of one's guests, but focus on the top button of their collar. Here, however, you are told to look above the eyes to the forehead of your guest.

koohiiStory1: Sign the guestbook page with your forehead. (Picture a guestbook full of forehead prints like thumbprints).
koohiiStory2: In New Zealand, people welcome guests by touching their foreheads together.
jp_example_words:
差額(さがく): balance, difference, margin
額(がく): picture (framed), amount (of money)
金額(きんがく): amount of money
額(ひたい): forehead, brow
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic:
This word has three really important meanings. It's probably best if you remember them all. Let's do this!
When you're a guest somewhere it's important to bring geoducks. But more than that, the amount of geoducks you bring is really what matters. If you don't have any live geoducks go ahead and bring any amount of framed pictures of geoducks instead. If you can't even do that, well, then you're going to have to tattoo geoducks on your forehead.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: If you're a guest you either have to have the right amount of geoducks, geoducks in framed pictures, or geoducks on your forehead. Otherwise you're a jerk.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Unfortunately, if you mess up any of these things, (the amount, the framed pictures, or the forehead tattoo) every other guest will gawk (がく) at you.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Feel the feel of hundreds of gawks. Feel ashamed as they gawk at you. How could you!?

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The guest page in this strange hotel must be sign by banging it with your forehead.
humanum_full_description_en:
" the amount of " old as " E " from " page ", " each " sound, the original meaning for the forehead, the hair that is more or less part of the eyebrows. "Shuowen": "Yun, Yan Ye. From the page, each sound." Han Zhang Heng (Xijing Fu): "Short forehead, big mouth and nose, different kinds of tricks."

" Amount " can mean the part of the object that is close to the top. Tang Yaohe "See the post in the bitter rain in Xia Ren Chou Xie Lv": "The damp smoke condenses the stove, and the grass covers the wall."

" Amount " also refers to plaque. Song Yangxin of the Southern Dynasties "Bizheng Tu": "Pre-Han Xiao He Shan Zhuanzhu, completed for the front hall, Tan Si March, inscribed his forehead."

" Amount " also refers to the prescribed amount . "Old Book of the Tang Dynasty·The Biography of Xiaoyou·Cui Yan": "The old amount of rent, especially hopes to reduce."
humanum_short_description_en: " the amount of " old as " E " from " page ", " each " sound, the original meaning for the forehead, the hair that is more or less part of the eyebrows.
humanum_full_description:
「額」古作「頟」，從「頁」，「各」聲，本義為額頭，即頭髮以下眉毛以上的部分。《說文》：「頟，顙也。从頁，各聲。」漢張衡〈西京賦〉：「脩額短項，大口折鼻，詭類殊種。」

　　「額」可表示物體上首接近頂端的部分。唐姚合〈酬任疇協律夏中苦雨見寄〉：「溼煙凝灶額，荒草覆牆頭。」

　　「額」也指匾額。南朝宋羊欣〈筆陣圖〉：「前漢蕭何善篆籀，為前殿成，覃思三月，以題其額。」

　　「額」還指規定的數目。《舊唐書‧孝友傳‧崔衍》：「舊額賦租，特望蠲減。」
humanum_short_description: 「額」古作「頟」，從「頁」，「各」聲，本義為額頭，即頭髮以下眉毛以上的部分。

「 額 」古作「 頟 」，從「 頁 」，「 各 」聲，本義為額頭，即頭髮以下眉毛以上的部分。《說文》：「頟，顙也。从頁，各聲。」漢張衡〈西京賦〉：「脩額短項，大口折鼻，詭類殊種。」 「 額 」可表示物體上首接近頂端的部分。唐姚合〈酬任疇協律夏中苦雨見寄〉：「溼煙凝灶額，荒草覆牆頭。」 「 額 」也指匾額。南朝宋羊欣〈筆陣圖〉：「前漢蕭何善篆籀，為前殿成，覃思三月，以題其額。」 「 額 」還指規定的數目。《舊唐書‧孝友傳‧崔衍》：「舊額賦租，特望蠲減。」
" the amount of" old as " E" from " page", " each" sound, the original meaning for the forehead, the hair that is more or less part of the eyebrows. "Shuowen": "Yun, Yan Ye. From the page, each sound." Han Zhang Heng (Xijing Fu): "Short forehead, big mouth and nose, different kinds of tricks." " Amount" can mean the part of the object that is close to the top. Tang Yaohe "See the post in the bitter rain in Xia Ren Chou Xie Lv": "The damp smoke condenses the stove, and the grass covers the wall." " Amount" also refers to plaque. Song Yangxin of the Southern Dynasties "Bizheng Tu": "Pre-Han Xiao He Shan Zhuanzhu, completed for the front hall, Tan Si March, inscribed his forehead." " Amount" also refers to the prescribed amount. "Old Book of the Tang Dynasty·The Biography of Xiaoyou·Cui Yan": "The old amount of rent, especially hopes to reduce."

額字的基本解释

額
é
见“额”。

額字的汉语字典释义

[①]［é］
［《廣韻》五陌切，入陌，疑。］
“额1”的繁体字。
(1)额头。眉上发下部位。
(2)物体上首接近顶端的部分。
(3)引申喻高。参见“額額”。
(4)匾额。
(5)指题写匾额。
(6)规定的数目。
(7)查名斥责。

額字的康熙字典解释

【戌集下】【頁字部】　額； 康熙笔画：18； 页码：页1406第40
【廣韻】五陌切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】鄂格切，?音峉。【說文】頟顙也。詳頟字註。　又叶逆各切，音咢。【後漢·城中謠】城中好高髻，四方高一尺。城中好廣眉，四方且半額。尺音綽。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [é]
["Guangyun" Five Moss Cuts, Entering Mos, Doubts. ]
Traditional Chinese characters for "量1".
(1) Forehead. Hair on the lower part of the eyebrow.
(2) The part near the top of the object.
(3) Yu Gao by extension. See "amount".
(4) The plaque.
(5) Refers to the inscription on the plaque.
(6) The prescribed number.
(7) Name investigation and reprimand.
amount
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
【戌集下】【Page Department】　長; Kangxi Strokes: 18; Page Number: Page 1406 No. 40
[Guang Yun] Five Moss Cut [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] [Zheng Yun] Ege Cut,? Yin Xie. [Said the text] Yun Ye also. Detailed note of Yun word.　The leaves cut each other against each other, and the sound shook. [Later Han·City Ballad] The city is very high in a bun, and the square is one foot tall. There is a wide eyebrow in the city, square and half forehead. The ruler is proficient.

Name meaning

é
вм. 额
Radicals: 客, 頁  (guest, geoduck)
Meaning Mnemonic
This word has three really important meanings. It's probably best if you remember them all. Let's do this!
When you're a guest somewhere it's important to bring geoducks. But more than that, the amount of geoducks you bring is really what matters. If you don't have any live geoducks go ahead and bring any amount of framed pictures of geoducks instead. If you can't even do that, well, then you're going to have to tattoo geoducks on your forehead.
If you're a guest you either have to have the right amount of geoducks, geoducks in framed pictures, or geoducks on your forehead. Otherwise you're a jerk.
Reading Mnemonic
Unfortunately, if you mess up any of these things, (the amount, the framed pictures, or the forehead tattoo) every other guest will gawk (がく) at you.
Feel the feel of hundreds of gawks. Feel ashamed as they gawk at you. How could you!?
